website_summaries.verdict: It's a good choice if you prefer all-natural products, but it costs significantly more than other products and doesn't necessarily work any better.
pros: 100% natural with zinc oxide and soothing plant-based oils
cons: Expensive considering you only get 3 oz
Some complaints of a change in the formula that isn't as effective as it once was

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE OF NEW FORMULA
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE - Completely different formula then before. I'm so bummed with the formula change. This used to be gentle and smell wonderful. Now it is too harsh for my little one's skin, leaving it irritated, dry and pealing. The great smell is no longer there. Such a great product that was completely ruined. If you loved this product as much as I DID, try to scoop up the old formula tubes off your local store shelves before they are gone. I can no longer use it, therefore I cancelled my subscription for it. Please contact Burt's Bees via their website and ask for the original formula back!!!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! Best Diaper Rash Cream
customer_reviews.text: Best diaper rash cream in the market. My little one has very sensitive skin and this does wonders, keeps diaper rash away. I apply a thick layer, the consistency is already thick, water glides right off so helps keep herself dry and all the wetness in the diaper. It’s scent is not bad either, after a while you can get over it but nothing you can’t deal with. When my baby girl was 3 weeks old we discovered that her armpits were very irritated very chapped, her doctor recommended to apply some of Burt’s Bees diaper rash cream and it worked like a charm. Gone within days.
customer_reviews.author: Estefanny Sigala

customer_reviews.title: Good option for a toxin-free diaper rash cream, but not the best.
customer_reviews.text: Good option for a toxin-free diaper rash cream, but not the best. Pros Safe ingredients; EWG score of 1 Fragrance free Good for sensitive skin; Didn't irritate my son Cons Consistency is off, in my opinion. This cream is a bit too firm and sticky for my taste, making it difficult to spread on baby's skin. I prefer Baby Mantra's diaper rash cream, but would be okay with using this in a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: coolitbrittneyTop Contributor: Running

customer_reviews.title: Get this NOW!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Our 1 year old got a really bad diaper rash while we were out of town. We bought some generic name stuff from the store. It didn’t do anything to help her. A family member we were visiting for the day suggested this and let us borrow some. We could see the difference immediately! It was thick as I applied it. It didn’t rinse off on the diaper and it was starting to heal her open wounds (yes, it was THAT bad). I ordered some as soon as we got home and she was completely healed in a matter for a day or two. It worked even faster and better than our regular cream!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy P.

customer_reviews.title: No artificial fragrance
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this a couple times for redness so far, but it was effective in reducing redness in the diaper region. I love that it is mostly zinc oxide and natural. This cream is very thick, almost like the texture of Butt Paste. I bought it because it has no artificial fragrances in it, unlike the generic brand I had been purchasing. It goes on fairly smoothly. I was a little hesitant about the labolin. If it prevents and treats diaper rash, I will likely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Good Zinc Oxide Based Cream for Cloth
customer_reviews.text: I've used this cream for 7 months now for on and off diaper rashes. I use cloth diapers so needed something zinc oxide based. I use this every night to prevent rashes, and during the day if we get a lot of redness. It works very quickly to get any redness I notice under control. My pediatrician recommended vaseline at one point, and that caused a much worse rash that wouldn't go away. The Burt's Bees cream took care of that rash very quickly. I won't be using vaseline again.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra M.

customer_reviews.title: Best diaper cream yet!
customer_reviews.text: We love this diaper cream for our baby's sensitive skin. One tube lasts us about 4-5 months, and we use for each diaper change. It stays in place. It isn't that easy to get off but that doesn't bother us. If we need to get it off, we use a little but of jojoba oil. The scent isn't ideal (kind of herbally) but it isn't terrible like desitin's. The only thing we don't like are the sharp edges of the container. Just be careful of your feet if it falls from the changing table. I also wouldn't give it to your little one even for a second because of the edges.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Burns
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after every lotion I know failed me. Due to Covid-19 I used so much hand sanitizer when I didn't have access to a sink that I burned my hands. My hands turned purple from all the burn spots and the only thing that helped calm it and heal it was this ointment. I'm so glad that I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Dannay Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Cloth diaper save alternative for Desitin
customer_reviews.text: My baby has contact dermatitis and the pediatrician told us to use Desitin with 40% zinc (purple packaging). Desitin is not cloth diaper safe and can cause repelling. We then discovered this product as a perfect alternative. It is save to use with cloth and won't cause repelling (the zinc however can cause stains). It also has 40% zinc. Did I mention that it smells really nice? We use it with every diaper change and apply it like thick icing. The tube last us two weeks so we use the subscription and have automatic delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Mama K

customer_reviews.title: Amazing cloth diaper safe cream
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this rash cream. I use cloth diapers and I've never had an issue with this at all. I love how potent it is. My son doesn't get rashes often, but when he does I smear this cream on him once and his rash is gone by morning. The smell reminds me of tree sap, which is fine for my family and I because we love that smell. All in all I don't have any bad things to say about it. It's an amazing cream not only in itself, but also for anyone looking for cream thats cloth diaper safe
customer_reviews.author: Joel & Amber

customer_reviews.title: Thick, works, smell is more natural than other brands
customer_reviews.text: Have tried butt paste and desitin, but those two are not thick enough paste to really hold up after each application. Plus desitin smells like some awful chemical smell. This has a more natural herbal smell and applies thick. Getting it out of the tube can be somewhat difficult towards the end though. So far it has kept little one's bottom from developing any more than just a spot of redness.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Best rash cream ever!
customer_reviews.text: A friend recommended this product and I’m so glad I got it! In the hospital they gave us some rash cream and we kept using it at home. When my baby was around 5 days he had an awful rash, I used this ointment and within hours it got better! We’ve used it for the last 3 weeks and he has not gotten any more rashes! It lasts long time! Is expensive compared to other products, BUT you don’t need as much, it spreads really well. I also love the smell...it’s kind of like lavender and chamomile.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Herradora

customer_reviews.title: Good for Entire Family
customer_reviews.text: As I've been trying to incorporate more "natural" products in my house (so long as they're "affordable"), this one made the cut. Regardless of age, some people get rashes. And, some people have "issues" in that area. This works. It's thick, but it works for any kind of irritation on my sensitive skin and those in my household. I've even used this as a first aid cream. Once applied, it does need a bit more "pressure" to wash off. I like the fact it doesn't have a "scent".
customer_reviews.author: Marie Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Great for diaper rash prevention
customer_reviews.text: This diaper rash cream has worked well for my newborn with sensitive skin. He got a lot of diaper rashes that were hard to clear up in the first couple months so I started putting this on him at every diaper change as a preventative measure. Almost 1 month later and no more diaper rashes! This cream is very thick but it still spreads and wipes off easily. We're still on our first tube because it doesn't take much at all. The scent is a little stronger than other creams but in my opinion it's not too strong or even unpleasant. I will be reordering this and will recommend to other parents.
customer_reviews.author: Icicle

customer_reviews.title: Best diaper rash cream ever!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this diaper rash cream! I’m on #4 & discovered this product for my 3rd baby about 4 years ago. A little goes a long way, works for sensitive skin issues, knocks out diaper rash Fast, stays on longer than butt paste ever did & doesn’t smell bad. Actually has a good scent. I won’t ever use anything else. Just bought as a gift too for a friend who just had a baby! And amazon has the best price, even better with subscribe & save!
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Roth

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: There is no scent, which I like. Anything I've ever used with perfume in it has always irritated my baby's delicate skin. This is the only diaper cream I use. I use it preventatively as well. Any time my baby gets a rash, (which is rare, but it happens to the best of us), I bathe him well and lather this cream on and it usually dissipates within the same day.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany McBride

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not a magic cream
customer_reviews.text: My baby was fortunate to not have very bad diaper rash, but this cream still only worked about 50% of the time. I would say that I liked it a lot more than Aquafor, though. One thing to keep in mind is that the main ingredient is zinc-based, so it's best to check with a pediatrician if they recommend that ingredient for your baby.
customer_reviews.author: Debounce

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is amazing! When my son was a newborn
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing! When my son was a newborn, he had a severe case of diaper rash. We tried everything, including prescription diaper creams, and this was the only product that cleared it up. Not only does it create a nice barrier, but it stays on. There were occasions that I was only able to get it all completed removed by bathing my son. I use Corona on a regular basis, but always keep the Burt’s on hand anytime there is the slightest hint of diaper rash.
customer_reviews.author: Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Over all you should buy
customer_reviews.text: Our son would always get very bad diaper rash. We used a lot of different brand creams and none were as effective as this one. The scent is very pleasant. Its hard to get out of the tube but it spreads easily. The big problem i dont like about it is that there's no option for a tub of cream rather then a tube. Towards the end of the tube, it is very hard to get the last bits out.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan alfrey

customer_reviews.title: My favorite butt cream
customer_reviews.text: Of all the creams I've tried I always go back to this one. I like the consistency of it and it creates a nice barrier. I use it about twice a day as a preventative and I have seen no signs of diaper rash. It smells kind of menthol-y but I don't really mind. It's nothing like the strong smell of A&D. I can't comment on its effectiveness of clearing up a rash because because my 5 month old has never had one but I have all the faith that this product will work well for that.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Good product, bad dispenser
customer_reviews.text: We’ve tried a bunch of creams and this is one of our favorites. I’m deducting one star because the tub dispenser is one of the worst ones I’ve used. You’ll get frustrated and toss out the last 30% of the bottle. Honest and the others have MUCH better tubes.
customer_reviews.author: B. Crosby

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great clearing up my newborn baby’s nasty diaper rash! I love being able to use a more natural diaper cream on his delicate skin. Burt’s Bees is the best! (I second all the moms who are requesting the cream be put in a jar, instead of a bottle, due to how thick it is!)
customer_reviews.author: Chew N.

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps it should be used as intended...
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would help with a mild/ medium case of perioral dermatitis due to high zinc oxide content. It clogged pores severely and made condition worse. It was also so thick and heavy, it was extremely difficult to squeeze ointment out of tube. I am still giving this 3 stars since it should get some kudos for being cruelty free/ not tested on animals, vegetarian (wish it was vegan), and since it didn't work for my household, probably best used as intended.
customer_reviews.author: JOBX

customer_reviews.title: Best diaper rash cream
customer_reviews.text: This is our favorite diaper rash cream. My 8 week old had a horrible diaper rash when she was 2 weeks old and this was the only cream that worked. It is really thick and it stays on really well. Some may not like that but it creates a great protective layer to help the skin heal from a bad rash. We still use this every day and love it!
customer_reviews.author: Karina

customer_reviews.title: Moms and. Dads, I have tried them all, but this is my favorite!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It smells good! Does not cause a reaction to sensitive skin One of the few that is lanolin-free (I’m allergic) Does excellent job to treating rash Pro-Tip from a former child care lead teacher: When baby’s bottom is truly flared up, apply the Burt’s bees butt cream, then create a mosture barrier with their all-purpose ointment on top. When baby pees, this keeps the ointment in contact with the skin so it continues to treat the rash, and the wetness can’t further irritate the skin.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Creamy and thick
customer_reviews.text: Our son battled acidic rash for weeks and we tried everything under the sun to treat and prevent, including prescription medication. We now only use burts bees diaper cream and it's on subscribe and save to make sure we never go without. I put this on with every diaper change as our little boy is very sensitive and so far we haven't had anymore rash breakouts. The cream is very thick and goes on smooth with great coverage that lasts well into the next diaper change. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for sensitive skin!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have been using Burt's Bees Natural Diaper Rash Ointment since we first realized our newborn was pretty sensitive to diaper cream. We have never had an issues with rashes since using this stuff and I personally really like the scent. It smells as baby-related products tend to smell, which to me smells really great. I am extremely glad that this stuff is on the market and for the few extra dollars that you pay for this product, I am more than happy to know that my baby is much more comfortable and in less pain than before.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Cheeseman

customer_reviews.title: A little goes a long way.
customer_reviews.text: Works quick and has more natural ingredients than other brands. Usually works within a diaper change or 2 for a red rash. We use it at night as well and it’s gentle enough for everyday or every night use. I wouldn’t say it smells great but it doesn’t smell chemically or unappealing. A little goes a long way and I recommend getting one of those baby rubber applicators.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: What can I say about this diaper cream except that it's amazing? I used this on my oldest when she had a terrible diaper rash, and nothing else was working, not even oatmeal baths. It was so bad that she screamed in her diaper and in baths. Cue this cream. It healed it in days. After that, we never went back. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ma

customer_reviews.title: Great for babies and adults!
customer_reviews.text: This tube was a gift, but I had purchased in the past. This product works very well for any rash in the nether regions, especially for my endometriosis rashes and my husband's lactose intolerance issues. This tube was gifted to expecting parents, who say it works great for their month old baby. It also has a nice herbal scent, instead of that gross baby powder smell. If highly recommend to anyone who has a rash that needs to be calmed.
customer_reviews.author: wen.tea

customer_reviews.title: CHANGED FORMULA DOES NOT PREVENT DIAPER RASHES - extremely thin, oily, and wipes right off, leaving the skin without a barrier!
customer_reviews.text: They changed the formula and it no longer prevents diaper rashes. We have been using the previous formula on our son for over a year and it did great in preventing diaper rashes, but as soon as we used the new formula, he had a really bad diaper rash the next day. It is so thin and oily, so it slides right off of his skin and my finger. The cream just wipes off onto the diaper, so his butt is left completely bare. The prior formula was very thick and adhered to my son’s bottom (and my finger) very well. I am so disappointed that they changed something that worked so great. Please bring back the previous formula!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Effective!
customer_reviews.text: I am a mother of 6. Each one of my kids have dealt with food sensitivities which causes severe rashes in their diaper area. I have tried almost everything on the market including making my own creams with coconut oil. Nothing seamed to work. This cream has been a life saver. After giving my babies a baking soda bath (adding a half cup baking soda into the bath water), and coating some Burt's Bees cream on before bed, they are 100% cleared up by morning. I also must add that it is not greasy or messy and goes on smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Spoelstra

customer_reviews.title: My favorite diaper cream!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love! My 18 month old is very sensitive to skin products. This diaper cream is so gentle. It absorbs nicely and doesn’t irritate him at all. Even though it does absorb into his skin (not like desitin that rests on top) it still creates the moisture barrier needed to keep him dry and prevent a rash. Burt’s Bees Baby products are all I use on him. Highly recommend and I am a loyal user to everything they make on the baby line.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: pretty much might as not not use this at all ...
customer_reviews.text: This newer version is just not right. It is completely different from the older one in a way that it is not as thick and not not protect my baby at all, pretty much might as not not use this at all because it doesnt do anything. I was using the older version for over a year and a half and it was The Best thing ive ever used for my kids, but this new formula gave my baby a rush, redness and pimples. NOT working for us anymore, have to find a replacement. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bruna

customer_reviews.title: Caused an allergic reaction of some sort
customer_reviews.text: After using this product my baby's very mild diaper rash turned into a blistering rash. I suspected it might be the cream because the red/blistering area was the exact pattern where I put the cream. I stopped using it, and the rash got better. Once completely healed, I spot-tested it again on a small patch of baby's skin. Yep, two hours later, that spot (and only that spot) was red with tiny blisters again. I love all of Burt's Bees products so I'm disappointed about how this one turned out. My baby has never had a reaction to any other products.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Protects More Naturally
customer_reviews.text: This creme does what it is intended to do. It does not spread easily because of the zinc, but that's the whole point of the product to form a thick protective layer on your skin. I appreciate the "clean" ingredients and feel good about using this product. I will be purchasing again once it runs out. I would recommend for babies as well as those with skin issues that need a protective layer to keep away germs.
customer_reviews.author: KScho

customer_reviews.title: Not great for sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: i do not recommend this for sensitive skin. My son had a bit of a diaper rash and I used this product on him once... his poor hiny became very swollen and red everywhere the product touched him way beyond the rash area.
customer_reviews.author: Snoopy doopy

customer_reviews.title: Best diaper cream
customer_reviews.text: This is the best diaper cream we have used. From bringing her home from the hospital to a year old. This cream has always been amazing. No scent, and love this line of products for baby. We keep it on hand in the car, 2 at home and 1 in the diaper bag always, so we never run out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but just apply a little because if you use too much it can overly dry the baby skin and cause a worse rash. I believe it's the z
customer_reviews.text: It works, but just apply a little because if you use too much it can overly dry the baby skin and cause a worse rash. I believe it's the zinc and it is very drying in so if you apply too much it can give the baby a horrible rash. It dried my baby skin out so much I had to stop using it so just be careful and apply the littlest amount needed.
customer_reviews.author: ebone johnson

customer_reviews.title: Gave my baby rash and burns
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited about using this diaper cream- the current one I use is seventh generation Or honest company but this seemed just as good but a little cheaper. Unfortunately it does not work for us. It has ended up giving my baby a rash that blisters so it’s almost like burns. As soon as I stop using this cream and to back to our Original ones the rash/blisters go away. At first I thought oh maybe he’s teething or it was something I ate because he’s breastfeed, so I tried it several different times on him and each time it happens and is only where the cream was.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is the only all natural cream that worked on diaper rash for us and I tried many! The key thing is that the skin has to be dry before applying the cream, that way it works better and you use very little of the cream...
customer_reviews.author: Beata

customer_reviews.title: BEST RASH CREAM OUT THERE
customer_reviews.text: THE ABSOLUTE BEST DIAPER RASH CREAM ON THE MARKET. I don’t understand why this isn’t in my stores but it should be, I was lucky enough to find it here on Amazon. It has been a life changing God send. Not only for my son but for myself. Perfect for sensitive skin and for little ones, I put it on at the hint of redness and it clears up immediately. To think that other creams can’t compare and this is natural is mind blowing. 10/10 recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Cheyenne

customer_reviews.title: Worst tube ever.
customer_reviews.text: Product is no better than other diaper creams but where they fall short is the packaging. The tube that the cream comes in is so stiff that you have to squeeze with all your strength to get the cream out. Once the cream gets about 50% used, that’s when all the fun starts. It becomes a tug of war to try to get the remainder of the cream out. If they could get another dispenser than this would be a fair product. Until then, no thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Diaper Cream!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried all types of baby diaper creams, both organic & non-organic & this is by far the best! If my baby has a red butt this stuff fixes it in no time. The only thing I don’t like is that because it is pretty thick, when you get down to the end of the tube I feel a lot of it goes to waste because you can’t get it out.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product - have been using it since my daughter was born 2 years ago. Works great and is gentle enough to use during every diaper change. Only con? Cap breaks off too easily and it’s really difficult to squeeze out towards the end.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Watson

customer_reviews.title: We miss the old formulation, but this one will do fine
customer_reviews.text: It's a good preventative cream as well as a "treatment" for mild to moderate rashes. It doesn't have as pleasant a smell as the old one (which we loved), but the smell is not bad. What I like about it is that it is very thick and will actually stay on baby's skin to help form a protective barrier. Some of the other diaper creams and pastes pretty much immediately get absorbed or wiped away by the diaper and doesn't really help, or you have to really slather it on thickly. This is the one we mainly use on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Better than Boudreaux's
customer_reviews.text: We use this after any #2 diaper that is very wet/loose or whenever we see redness to help prevent diaper rash. Consistency is thick (but not too thick) and goes on smooth. Pleasant, light scent. We had been using Boudreaux's Butt Paste, but it simply does not provide as good of a barrier as the Burt's Bees and Aquaphor (used for routine changes). This resulted in a terrible diaper rash that required Rx cream and Aquaphor to resolve. The Burt's Bees cream eliminates any redness by the next diaper change and we have not had a recurrence of diaper rash for over a year now.
customer_reviews.author: Bradelicious

customer_reviews.title: Will not being using it after one week or use.
customer_reviews.text: We thought this was a good product until our newborn baby started getting a pretty bad rash on day two of using it. It wouldn't go away until almost a week later when we switched to Desitin, which got rid of the rash within 24 hours. I'm not sure if it'd that our baby is allergic to something in the Burts Bees cream or if Desitin is just that much better of a product. Anyhow, we won't be using it again although we have more than half of the tube left.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Kim

customer_reviews.title: Anti-fungal--great for yeast diaper rashes
customer_reviews.text: The company does not make this claim, but this is anti-fungal--great for yeast diaper rashes. I used it for a fungal infection on my eyelids and it worked better than the expensive prescription ointment from my MD.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Really like this diaper cream. It does have a scent but it says it’s natural and it hasn’t irritated my babies skin at all. It is a thick consistency but I find that the thicker the creams are the better they perform.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Good diaper rash cream
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cream. It gets rid of diaper rash very quickly. I only gave it 4 stars because it's so hard to get out of the tube. When our little guy is squirming around on his changing table, it's hard to hold his legs with one arm, and get this out of the tube. It would be better in a lidded jar.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie McMinn

customer_reviews.title: Great. Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. I put some on my baby every night since he sleeps through the night and I dont change him for a long period. He only got a rash one time (when he was in the NICU). This cleared it up in one day! And because of this, we never had an issue with diaper rashes again. Because it's so thick, I really recommend using it with a bum applicator that I also got on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Fawkeia Sorian

customer_reviews.title: I thought we had found the perfect diaper rash cream
customer_reviews.text: After seeing all the positive reviews for this product, I thought we had found the perfect diaper rash cream. We tried it multiple times, I believe it offered our LO some soothing, but it did nothing for the rash. Now we use aden + anais or aquaphor, both of which clear up a rash very quickly. Our pediatrician recommended aquarphor...and after a dry winter, I have started using it on my hands.
customer_reviews.author: David Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this natural product. No scent which is nice. I tiny bit goes a long way. I don't even have to put it on after each changing and my 2 month old has yet to get a diaper rash.
customer_reviews.author: eeswi

customer_reviews.title: Better than butt paste!
customer_reviews.text: Love this for our little guy’s sensitive skin. The popular Butt paste seemed to make his redness worse, so I’m glad I tried this. The tube is small but it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: J. Chapman

customer_reviews.title: A good zinc cream , thick enough and mild pleasant smell
customer_reviews.text: Stays on skin very well, whether that is baby/children's skin or grownup's skin. Use it with every diaper change to always have a barrier for the tender skin, especially after a poopy diaper, zinc cream helps to cover the stinky smell too. Use the zinc cream to keep my fingers from splitting, with a lot of drying-out hand washing. Nice mild scent. Liike that one can pronounce and know what all the ingredients are, and with a lot of zinc. Really do not like the new labeling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Diaper Rash Ointment
customer_reviews.text: When our baby was little he had a really really bad diaper rash. We tried many others including Butt Paste, Desitin, and a few others. My doc told us to use an ointment and a hair dryer. So we started using a hair dryer after every diaper change then this. It is amazing! It stays on so well, it will still be on his butt in the morning when he wakes up and keeps out the moisture so well. But it feels like a cream and smells great even though it's an ointment. We love it!
customer_reviews.author: AliAnne84

customer_reviews.title: Like don’t like
customer_reviews.text: It gave my daughter a bigger rash than what she already had. I bought it because it said sensitive skin and it is precisely what my daughter has but it made it worse. Maybe it’s the scents in the cream.
customer_reviews.author: Yoselin

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: Love it! My toddler had a horrible diaper rash from the stomach flu (from going poop so much) this diaper cream cleared it up super fast. My baby used to cry when I wiped of how bad the rash was and this worked wonders on his butt. I read the reviews that said it was sticky and that’s great you want it to be sticky so it can protect the skin.
customer_reviews.author: GG :)

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Thick Barrier When You Need It
customer_reviews.text: Definitely creates a barrier if you lather it on. My pediatrician said to put it on "like icing a cake." Works for overnight or when you really need it, but can be messy to put on and difficult to clean off baby's skin and especially off of cloth diapers. I keep this as a last resort and opt for an herbal-based diaper balm when needed, though since we started doing elimination communication we haven't needed any of these!
customer_reviews.author: A.W.

customer_reviews.title: Miracle cream!
customer_reviews.text: Diaper rash sucks!! Our 3 month old has quite the sensitive bottom and this is a wonder cream. I put it on him at bedtime and by morning he looks much better. It is super thick and really a pain to get out of the tube (and off of clothes, flailing legs/feet, fingers, etc)... it is about a hundred times harder to get out of the tube compared to butt paste and Desitin. It doesn't rub off onto the diaper, which is probably why it works so well! It has a pleasant smell and is white.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Z.

customer_reviews.title: Prevents diaper rash!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite diaper cream!! I put a small amount on my son every night and he’s never gotten diaper rash! Other brands I’ve tried have gotten weirdly wet and seemed to separate after using about half of the tube, but this one stays thick and creamy. There is no scent that I can detect and my son has never reacted poorly to it. A little goes a long way too! I’ll continue to use it as long as I have babies in diapers.
customer_reviews.author: The Sands

customer_reviews.title: Prefer original formula
customer_reviews.text: The new formula is thick but doesn’t feel exactly the same & smell is like other ointments. Oil keeps separating from the product & even after try to shake it well, it doesn’t mix.
customer_reviews.author: Sid Ra

customer_reviews.title: Not for us
customer_reviews.text: I used to use buttpaste but wanted a more natural option with zinc oxide. This paste is very thick and doesn’t spread well. My baby got a rash and instead of this taking care of the redness, it just got worse and became a yeast infection.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Evans

customer_reviews.title: Works great for diaper rash
customer_reviews.text: Both my boys have used this brand for their diaper rashes. It worked great. Most times, you can see improvement after a day or so.
customer_reviews.author: Steven T.

customer_reviews.title: Thick and Healing
customer_reviews.text: We love this diaper cream for our babies. Best cream we have found since it is thick and can heal a "burnt bottom" in a day or so. Just lather it up before bed on their bottom and it is already looking better in the morning. This is our favorite cream. Pleasant scent that isn't as strong as other brands.
customer_reviews.author: A.S.

customer_reviews.title: Top buy since newborn
customer_reviews.text: I buy this all the time. Calms down irritated skin on diaper area and it also smells really good. Plus Burt’s Bees its a great brand that uses natural ingredients
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Cloth Diaper Safe
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this diaper cream because it has zinc oxide, but does not have petroleum. My hope was that I could use this with my cloth diapers. Sadly, the cream did not wash out of my diapers. I give this cream five stars because it did well at treating the actual diaper rash. The product does not claim to be cloth diaper safe, I just thought it might from reading the ingredients. Good cream, but not for cloth.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Natural and smells good but doesn't do the job.
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this diaper rash cream for my little one who gets diaper rash often. I was hoping that it being natural would be helpful since my little one has sensitive skin but this was not strong enough. I ended up going back to Desitin.
customer_reviews.author: teach326

customer_reviews.title: Great cream
customer_reviews.text: Wow - great diaper cream. My daycare suggested it and said it was the thickest diaper cream they'd ever seen so it stays on and continues to work longer. I agree!
customer_reviews.author: A. Leavitt

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is by far my favorite diaper rash cream - we tried Dr. Boudreaux's Butt Paste on a recommendation from a friend. I find that too watery and switched to Burt's Bees. In most cases, if I put the cream on at night the rash will be gone by morning.
customer_reviews.author: R. Patton

customer_reviews.title: Good cream, bad packaging
customer_reviews.text: The cream itself is good. I like that it's natural and indeed effective. The difference between this and A+D is 1) the texture is dense. 2) the tube is very tough. The dense texture is not a problem itself and totally personal preference, but because of the hard tube material, at some point you cannot squeeze any more out. But if you cut the tube open you'll find about 1/3 left in there. That's a lot.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Not helpful for skin.
customer_reviews.text: A diaper cream should NOT have fragrance. It can cause your child to develop contact dermatitis from the fragrance and other ingredients. Does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product, hard to use
customer_reviews.text: I like this product. It is thick and made with good ingrediants. The downside is their packaging, it doesn't work well as the container makes it impossible to use the last third, as the paste is so thick you cannot squeeze it out to apply. They should know this and re-think delivery into a thinner, longer tube like neosporin. I wont buy again after initial 2 purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT for little one's with sensitive skin!!
customer_reviews.text: My little guy has super sensitive skin and is prone to rashes. We started using this about a year ago and have been so happy. No rashes and no breakouts!!! It applies nice and isn't too runny so we don't waste a lot (something I hate doing). A little definitely goes a long way with this. Definitely recommend to anyone looking for a new butt cream :)
customer_reviews.author: Amanda N

customer_reviews.title: Sadly Didn't Work for My Baby
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this as I have gotten good results from Burt's Bee beauty products. But unfortunately, it didn't work for my baby. It actually made the diaper rash worse. Maybe my baby was allergic to some ingredients in there since every baby has unique skin.
customer_reviews.author: CT Family

customer_reviews.title: Hypoallergenic
customer_reviews.text: Spreads on thick (which I consider a good thing) and heals diaper rashes quickly. Great for sensitive skin.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Zehr

customer_reviews.title: difficult to squeeze
customer_reviews.text: this is a very thick cream ans difficult to squeeze out of the bottle. I have to unscrew the cap to use. With that being said, it goes on smooth. I do really like the cream but the container doesn't work for it, and I probably would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: cooperstar

customer_reviews.title: Great for diaper rash
customer_reviews.text: Works great covering up diaper rash. Burts Bee's as a whole is a pretty good brand.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca B

customer_reviews.title: Best diaper cream ever!
customer_reviews.text: I am a cloth diaper mama, so I have to be careful about which diaper creams I buy so I don't ruin my diapers. This stuff is amazing, I swear it works better than Boudreaux's and Desitin. My baby got a bad diaper rash and this cleared it up in less than 24 hours. I will definitely be a repeat customer.
customer_reviews.author: Cicely

customer_reviews.title: pricey but works and smells great
customer_reviews.text: Burt's Bees is one of the more expensive brands of diaper rash ointment on the market. But frankly it works well and smells great. We use it for a variety of skin issues and not diaper rash only.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Works for us
customer_reviews.text: We’ve tried many diaper creams, but this one works the best for us! Spreads well, little to no scent, and reduces redness quickly and efficiently.
customer_reviews.author: emily d

customer_reviews.title: The ONLY thing that works.
customer_reviews.text: This was the ONLY thing that really worked as described, this cream along with using Water Wipes put my week old son at ease, THANK YOU.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan R.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for us at all!
customer_reviews.text: This didn't work for us! Used this from the get go and baby developed a BAD rash. This did not prevent or treat. Really wanted to like this product as it seemed "natural" but had to turn to Desitin to clear up the rash.
customer_reviews.author: jenerationmama

customer_reviews.title: Smells like muscle ointment
customer_reviews.text: Has a scent, but because of how effective the product is, its almost comforting to smell it because I know its working magic on diaper rash
customer_reviews.author: Sandi

customer_reviews.title: Best Baby Rash Cream On The Market
customer_reviews.text: This product is better than any other competitors. I’ve tried Desitin and Butt Paste. This Burt’s Bees Baby is the most quick working effective diaper rash cream. Buy it. You will be pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Rapid healing
customer_reviews.text: Best diaper cream ever! If my baby gets red I put on the cream and the redness goes away in a few hours. I used it for when he was little his neck was short and could get rush on the neck too so I used it everywhere!!!
customer_reviews.author: I I

customer_reviews.title: My 2 year old, whom now thankfully is out ...
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old, whom now thankfully is out of diapers, had diaper rash maybe 2-3 times her entire life. Her little sister, who as of today is 8 months old, has never had it... I doubt that my wife or I do anything extraordinary or different from most, to keep our daughters' butts clean. From what I understand, diaper rash is common and re-occouring for lots of babies. I'm very thankful mine do not, but I honestly attribute their healthy little bums to this stuff. Most impressive Burt's, most impressive.
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: Yes this is the diaper rash cream you need!
customer_reviews.text: Thicker consistency, and works great on diaper rash. This has been our go to for 3.5 years! Little goes long way. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Baby diaper rash
customer_reviews.text: I was using a much more expensive diaper cream and was looking for something a bit more budget friendly that also did not have a bunch of garbage in the ingredients and is safe for cloth diapers. We are on day 4 of use and her diaper rash is cleared up! It's a nice thick paste and I think it gives a great layer of protection. We started seeing some redness after our daughter was extending her nighttime sleep, we put a heavy later on before bed time and it has made a huge difference.
customer_reviews.author: G. Tooley

customer_reviews.title: Good overall product
customer_reviews.text: I like it better than the mustella but haven’t tried any other. It’s a little hard to get out of the tube but apart from that I like the smell and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Joe L

customer_reviews.title: I am using this product for the first time and ...
customer_reviews.text: I am using this product for the first time and it seems as though this maximum strength formula does work as well as the original. With the original I could start to see improvement in redness within one or two diaper changes, but with the maximum strength it seems to take three to four times longer.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great product, pleasant smell
customer_reviews.text: I got this product as an alternative to the max strength Butt Paste. It's worked just as well for healing and preventing rashes, but it has a pleasant smell and is cloth diaper safe.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Great for sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: I have tried every diaper ointment out there. This is a great gentle maintenance ointment. It may not immediately soothe a bad diaper rash but will help prevent bad ones from flaring up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality is hit or miss
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite diaper cream but buying it online is hit or miss when it comes to quality. The first container I bought was wonderful and smooth. The second one was so thick I couldn’t get it out of the tube.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for us
customer_reviews.text: We never used the old formulation, so I guess we don't know what we're missing, but the new formula works great and honestly doesn't smell bad to us -- especially compared to some of the other zinc creams out there! This cream worked great to clear up our daughter's pretty nasty diaper rash. We'll definitely be using it going forward -- it works like the "butt paste" but smells a lot better!
customer_reviews.author: C. Carnevale

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE and cannot say enough about this diaper cream
customer_reviews.text: This product is a lifesaver. I tried several other diaper creams, including the Honest company (we use honest diapers) and NOTHING helped my infants diaper rash. I ordered this as a last effort, and within one day it was noticeably improved, within 2-3 days tops, it was completely resolved. I LOVE and cannot say enough about this diaper cream. It is the only one we will use in our home going forward.
customer_reviews.author: aimee m finch

customer_reviews.title: good products
customer_reviews.text: The ingredients don't sound too horrible, but I haven't really run into any zinc diaper rash cream that I've hated. I've used the Honest company one and the Babyganics one and they're good as well too. The zinc baby rash creams all smell about the same and are about the same consistency. I didn't really think that any one brand I've used (of the three) prevents redness better or heals faster.
customer_reviews.author: iheartyou

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: I thought this program was going to work for my baby girl instead it made her rash so much worse! I was so pissed I flung it out after realizing it did not work.
customer_reviews.author: Liza

customer_reviews.title: A good choice for your little one
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this cream as it was the right price for a "natural" choice. We have used it off and on over the past 6 months with mixed results. Sometimes it comes out with a good consistency, other times it comes out runny and oily. This does provide good protection as an overnight cream. It is not my favorite but does work well.
customer_reviews.author: Mommyof3littles

product_meta.title: Burt's Bees Baby 100% Natural Diaper Rash Ointment - 3 Ounce (Pack of 1)
product_meta.description: Burts Bees Baby 100% Natural Diaper Rash Ointment has protecting properties to treat and prevent diaper rash. Its 100% natural with 40% zinc oxide, the maximum strength needed to seal out moisture that can irritate your babys bottom. This diaper rash ointment nourishes and reconditions skin naturally with shea butter, lavender oil and jojoba seed oil while creating an emollient layer to absorb wetness leaving babys skin soft, dry, and smooth. Pediatrician-tested and safe for your babys delicate skin. This ointment is formulated with no parabens, phthalates, petrolatum or SLS and is not tested on animals. Nurture and protect your babys skin naturally with Burts Bees Baby Bee.
feature_bullets: BABY DIAPER OINTMENT: Treat and prevent diaper rash in a safe, effective and natural way with this ointment that leaves baby bottoms soft and dry.
SOOTH SKIN: Made with 40% Zinc Oxide and Sweet Almond Oil, this maximum strength ointment helps calm and protect irritated skin against moisture.
BABY SKIN CARE: Enriched with shea butter, lavender oil and jojoba seed oil, this rash ointment naturally revitalizes your baby's delicate skin.
NATURAL BABY CARE: This 100% natural diaper rash ointment is formulated without parabens, phthalates, petrolatum or SLS and is not tested on animals.
PEDIATRICIAN TESTED: This Burt’s Bees diaper rash ointment is clinically proven to be safe, effective and non-irritating for everyday, soothing relief.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
